page_content:
Consolidated Summary Report and Summary Table Generator

Version:MissionOS_2.0

The table generator is a means to create tables from instrument and construction data models. There are several types of tables.

For Consolidated Summary reports you must first define summaries for the data within the data models. Here you can consolidate data with min, average, max, count and other operators. Once you have these summaries in place the consolidated summary table generator enables you to create comparative report looking at changes.

Note:

The fields that can be selected are based on the setup done in Summary tab under Admin > Data Object Configuration > Object Definition > Summary. For information about how to create the settings under Summary for a specific Type and Subtype, see Summary Report Template Creation (Normal Instruments). This setup creation is a precondition for Summary Table Generator.

To access the table generator select the table generator button on the top left of the canvas. The table generator is placed here because it defines a table layout. The resulting table must be added to the element list and then dragged and arranged in the report window.

In the Portal Homepage, click Report Creation > Canvas Sheets.

The Canvas Sheets interface opens. In the Canvas Sheets interface,

  1. Click Summary Table Generator.

 

 

 

  1. Now select the Consolidated Summary. This tab lists out several summary object categories form which Summaries can be created based on different parameters.
  1. For this example, choose Selected Subtype. Select from the following dropdown menus:
  • Type
  • Subtype
  • Summary Table template
  1. Click Create New Report Template

 

 

 

The user is taken to an interface for template creation where DEFINITION, SETUP and DATA fields list down the configured entries during summary template creation.

How to use Table Generator for row-wise data display:

Follow the steps below for template creation:

  1. Enter Table name and description.
  2. Select the Cover Page option if required. With this you can set up a cover page which has no instrument related data. The cover page is created as a separate CSR, with table creation in the same way, but without any fields and containing only text.
  3. Click the Insert menu and then Table to add table with the required rows and columns.

 

 

 

  1. To add labels/titles for the fields, type in the cells of the first row as required.
  2. You can drag and drop the Definition/Setup/Data Fields in selected cells.
  3. You can add Data Units, Review, Field Grouping and Graph Templates accordingly.

Note:

You can edit, format and build the table based on the type of report structure you want in the Consolidated Summary. Table options such as table properties, delete table, insert row options are available in the box. Several options like cell/row/column operations and alignment, paragraph options are available in this editor interface.

 

 

 

  1. Click Save &Preview Table button.

 

 

 

  1. Data Display Options pop-up opens.
  2. There are two options in the Show Data dropdown menu. Select the option Row Wise in order to tabulate data in rows.
  3. Select from the following options as per the requirements of the report to be generated:
  • Include only latest data – tabulate only the latest data for each instrument.
  • Highlight Review Colour – Breached data will be displayed as per the review colour.
  • Include Row Numbers – For displaying row index, if required. For this you need to create a separate column for Row Number to the left while creating table.
  • Split into pages – Used for displaying rows per page. Repeater Header option decides which header needs to be repeated after the selected # of rows per page.

 

 

 

 

 

  1. Click Ok. Newly created report lists under Summary Tables Library.

Available reports can be sorted based on Table Name, Report Type, Created By, Date Created and Date Modified.

 

 

 

Several options are available for each report. They are as follows:

  • Click Preview Table Headings
  • Click CSV to generate csv for a selected period of time.
  • Click Edit to edit a report.
  • Click Delete to delete the report.

 

 

Consolidated Summary Report on Canvas Sheets:

In the Canvas Sheets interface, you can add the consolidated summary as canvas elements:

  1. Click the arrow at Summary to expand the menu.
  2. Select the Selected Subtype and then the corresponding report.
    The Consolidate Summary interface opens.

 

 

  1. In the Consolidate Summary interface, select the parameters needed for the table data:
  2. Enter Title for summary element.
  3. Select a date range or last number of days or Last Week/Last Month/Last Three Months.
  4. Select Project/Contract/Site and Zone.
  5. Select the Individual Instrument Report On this, the consolidated report displays graphs for individual instruments. This is achievable only when the user adds graph templates of the instrument subtype during CSR template creation.
  6. Click Add Summary Element
    Summary element gets added in canvas library.

 

Refer to the figure below to view Consolidate Summary interface:

 

 

Create canvas sheet with summary element:

Drag and drop the summary element to canvas sheet. Enter the fields required and click Save.

 

 

 

The saved Canvas Sheet lists in the Canvas Library.

Click the Preview button on the saved Canvas Sheet.

The Consolidated Summary Report downloads in another browser.

 

Sample Consolidated Summary Report (created through row-wise method)

Refer to the figure below to see how the report looks with data displaying row wise:

 

 

 

How to use Table Generator for column-wise data display:

To reach the Table Generator Editor interface, follow the same steps as mentioned in the Row Wise Table Generator section.

To generate a table with column wise data display, specific steps are to be followed as below:

  1. In the Table Generator interface, enter Table Name.
  2. Then, enter the description. Select the Cover Page checkbox, if required.
  3. Open the Table
  4. Select the rows and columns for table based on requirements
  5. Taken On is to be given in the second field/column. For entering this, open the DATA tab in the panel. Then drag the Date/Time element from the panel to the column cell required. Refer to the figure below to see how this is done.
  6. Type the labels in the second row. Then drag the corresponding fields from the DATA panel below the corresponding labels. Refer to the figure below to see how this is done. The fields highlighted in green are those elements which you drag and drop from the panel on the right-hand side.
  7. Click Save & Preview Table button. A Data Display Options pop-up appears.

 

 

 

  1. For displaying row index in the report, if required, you need to create a separate column for Row Number to the left while creating table.

 

 

 

In the Data Display Options pop-up, perform the following steps to generate a column-wise Consolidated Summary Report:

  1. Select Show Data as Column Wise.
  2. Select the Include Row Numbers checkbox if required and select In Column as 1 and starting from value 1 if you want to include Row Numbers.
  3. Select the No of Dates to display. This depends on how many date columns must appear in the report. (5 for example)
  4. Select the Columns to repeat checkboxes as required.
  5. Repeat from row appears preselected as 1.
  6. Click Ok. (Refer to the figure below to view the Data Display Options)

 

 

Search for the Report in the Summary Tables Library.

Return to Report Creation > Canvas Sheets window.

In the Canvas Sheets interface,

  1. Click open the Summary
  2. Select the Selected Subtype
  3. The Consolidated Summary panel opens.
  4. Type the Title Name.
  5. Select the Last Number of Days and enter the days. (This must be the same as the No of Dates to display selected for Table Generator while saving it.)
  6. Select from Project and other dropdown options based on requirement.
  7. Click Add Summary Element

 

 

In the Edit Canvas Sheet window, perform the following steps:

  1. Enter the Title name and other fields.
  2. Drag the created element to the area from the list of elements on the left.
  3. Adjust the element within the area.
  4. Click Save.

Refer to the figure below to view the steps in creating canvas sheet and adding summary element to the sheet:

 

 

 

  1. As the Canvas Sheet is created, click Preview.

 

 

 

  1. In the pop-up that appears, Enter Reference Date, which is data covering 7 days prior to the date that you enter.
  2. Click Preview.

 

 

Sample Consolidated Summary Report (created through column-wise method)

Here is a sample of the Consolidated Report created through the column wise method.

Note that in creating this report, the Row Number column is not included, which means the corresponding checkbox in Data Display Options is not selected in the initial steps.
